title: Nestlé to Refresh Bottled-Water Business as Sales Turn Flat
text:
Nestlé SA said it would overhaul its struggling bottled-water arm, hoping to reinvigorate growth in a business grappling with rising competition, high costs and growing concerns about single-use plastic.

The world’s biggest packaged-food maker said its water arm, which sells brands like Poland Spring, San Pellegrino, Pure Life and Perrier, would go from being a stand-alone, globally managed business with headquarters in France, to one managed locally in Nestlé’s various regions.
